entry.title: U.S. Supreme Court split over Obamacare challenge
entry.summary:
Earnest doubted a legislative remedy, saying Republicans who control Congress "struggle mightily to do even the simplest, most politically popular things" and have fought Obamacare "tooth and nail."

On a chilly, damp, cloudy day, a couple hundred demonstrators mostly from pro-Obamacare forces gathered outside the white marble columned courthouse.

entry.title: U.S. Supreme Court split over Obamacare challenge
entry.summary:
A ruling favoring the challengers could cripple the law dubbed Obamacare, the president's signature domestic policy achievement.

Their shares have been under pressure amid the risk Obamacare insurance would disappear if the subsidies are dismantled as the challengers demand.

entry.title: Supreme Court Divided Over Challenge to Obamacare
Doctors, patients scramble ahead of high court Obamacare decision
entry.summary: The White House, which said it is confident the justices will rule in favor of the subsidies that are a key element of Obamacare, said it has no immediate fix if the decision goes the other way.

entry.title: Doctors, patients scramble ahead of high court Obamacare decision
entry.summary: He and other physicians are also scheduling Obamacare patients for preventive screenings, completing lab work, and writing prescription refills.

entry.title: Obama defends lack of 'Plan B' for Obamacare court case
entry.summary: On the Affordable Care Act, his signature policy achievement commonly referred to as Obamacare, the Supreme Court is set to hear oral arguments on Wednesday in the case known as King v.

entry.title: 11.4 million Americans sign up for Obamacare at deadline, White House says
More Than 11 Million Enrolled in Obamacare
